column2: #When two variables are strongly correlated it is best to run the model with only one of them, unless you have a strong biological reason to not do this
#now our dataset is readly lets fit our first model (Chapter 5 in SDM)
#lets start with a simple Generalized Linear Model (glm)
m1 <- glm(pb ~ bio1 + bio13 + bio10, data=sdmdata)
glm(formula = pb ~ bio1 + bio13 + bio10, data = sdmdata)
Null deviance: 77.644  on 389  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 73.907  on 386  degrees of freedom
